explanation: The report is not correct. In OS_TimeBaseCreate_Impl the timebase pointer is used to modify the object: specifically timebase->external_sync is assigned (timebase->external_sync = OS_TimeBase_SigWaitImpl;). MISRA R8.13 only requires adding const when the pointee is never modified; here the pointee is clearly written, so it must not be a pointer-to-const. (The agent’s scenario also mentions OS_TimeBase_SigWaitImpl, which is a different function; if that separate function only reads the pointee, then that function’s local pointer could be const, but that does not make the OS_TimeBaseCreate_Impl declaration incorrect.)
